title: Strengthening Business Strategy Practical Competencies: Mathematics-Based Green Infrastructure Projects for a Sustainable Future

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational mathematical concepts and basic understanding of environmental education
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for Corporate Management/HR Professionals

learning_goals: Cultivate the ability to present green infrastructure design proposals by mathematically modeling real-world environmental issues

Learners will develop a project-based instructional framework for teacher-student-community collaboration within six months and submit deliverables meeting the following: 1) three or more interview guides for stakeholder needs analysis, 2) a five-stage project design process (planning-execution-evaluation-feedback-dissemination), 3) two practical templates (checklist, evaluation form).
Acquire the ability to analyze sustainability indicators using data visualization tools

Learners will apply three or more communication strategies (active listening, situational channel selection, structured feedback) when collaborating with interdisciplinary teams (technology, marketing, finance) and resolve 80% or more of project conflicts, achieving 4+ points (on a 5-point scale) in team member satisfaction surveys.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
